page.title: 12Chells Manor,Stevenage.
page.content: {Chells Manor}takes its name from Hugh de Chelsen (a knight templar),it appears as SCELVA in the{Doomsday Book and lies 4km. east of Stevenage.The brick/half timber framed{house}was built in the late 14th century,wings were added in the 16th century, then further altered,including rough cast facing over the original. {Buildings}number five houses and three barns,all of brick after a fire in 1896 destroyed the wooden outer buildings.Chells Manor has always had a farming basis. People living in Chells Green Cottages normally worked for the manor's owner.Mr Appleyard ,a farmer, has lived there since 1947, apart from a short visit to his{farms in Ireland and Australia.The farm now belongs to an estate agent, and with the development of Stevenage{New {Town,}the Manor may be lost.
